title: Why did scientists search for exoplanets? - Quora

response.answer_text: Scientists are people with curiosity multiplied. We have an arduous need to answer questions. We seek answers to the questions that baffled us since the infancy of humanity. To just be content with the strange explanation of humanity and earth to be a once and for all an accidental and single phenomenon is stupendous. Hence we look out to the universe for answers. Where did we come from? Where are we going? Are we alone? Is sun the only star with planets? If not how many are there? Out of those, how many are earthlike? Of those how many are habitable? Of those which can ve visit and perhaps colonize once…all these questions needs answers. I do need them, don't you?

the scientists are searching for exoplanets for the little seeds of life that we had on earth a long time ago(some 1000000000000 years ago) so that they can also find a planet suitable for life-forms and also the human kind that can also bring the change  regards,
